definitions.name: list

text.english:
Let \(succ(n)\) denote the successor of \(n\). The set of the natural numbers \(\mathbb N\) is defined as follows:
  • \(0 \in \mathbb N\)
  • \(\forall n \in \mathbb N . succ(n) \in \mathbb N\).
text.italiano:
L'insieme delle liste di un qualsiasi tipo \$A\$ \(L_A) è definito come segue:
  • \([] \in L_A\)
  • \(\forall a \in A . \forall l \in L_A . a :: [] \in L_A \).

definitions.coq:
Variable A : Type.
Inductive list : Type := | nil : list | cons : A -> list -> list.
Infix "::" := cons (at level 60, right associativity).
Notation "[ ]" := nil (format "[ ]").
Notation "[ x ]" := (cons x nil).
Notation "[ x ; y ; .. ; z ]" := (cons x (cons y .. (cons z nil) ..)).

definitions.name: app

text.english:
Let \( ({+}) : \mathbb N \times \mathbb N \to \mathbb N \) be defined as follows:
  • \(0 + m \triangleq m\)
  • \( succ (n) + m \triangleq succ (n + m) \).
text.italiano:
Sia \( ({+}) : \mathbb N \times \mathbb N \to \mathbb N \) definito come segue:
  • \(0 + m \triangleq m\)
  • \( succ (n) + m \triangleq succ (n + m) \).

definitions.coq: Fixpoint app (l1 l2 : list) : list := match l1 with | [] => l2 | a :: l1' => a :: app l1' l2 end.

text.english: Addition is distributive: \[ \forall a, b, c \in \mathbb N . (a + b) + c = a + (b + c) \]
text.italiano: L'addizione è distributiva: \[ \forall a, b, c \in \mathbb N . (a + b) + c = a + (b + c) \]
